newsitem.title: UK: British bobbies get new look for millennium.
newsitem.headline: British bobbies get new look for millennium.

text.p: Britain's "bobbies", renowned for their distinctive Prussian-style helmets around the world, will get a new look for the next millennium.

The distinctive headgear worn by British policemen since 1863 will be worn only for ceremonial duties. For everyday patrols bobbies will sport cycling-style helmets equipped with radio link and eye shields, American-style blouson jackets and bullet-proof T-shirts.
The new outfit is part of the biggest overall change of image of the British police since the force was formed by Sir Robert Peel in 1828.

"We're not losing the policeman's helmet, we're bringing it into the 21st century," Assistant Commissioner Bill Hughes of the West Yorkshire Police, who led the Uniform Project Group, told The Observer newspaper.
The Association of Chief Police Officers has accepted the suggested changes from the group and the new look should be seen throughout Britain in 1998.
